data.title: Awesome place
data.text: Very nice restaurant with great food! This is my third time here and planning on coming back! Good place to bring your family or hanging with friends after work!

data.title: Disappointed with the salmon
data.text:
My meal was completely forgotten (I was at a business dinner meeting),  and when this was pointed out I was hurriedly presented with mostly raw salmon. 
I didn't get much of an apology. 
This is not a place I'll be coming back to.

data.title: Chain Restaurant, No way
data.text:
When you have local eateries featuring local or near local food sources,  why would you go to a chain restaurant?
The Label presents an enticing menu featuri gormet bugers. We started with a  generously sized fried pickle appetizer. The burger was cooked perfectly. The fries were tossed in parmesan butter and served with a dipping sauce. 
The only reason this review didn't receive a 5 rating was the waitress, who was very pleasant, forgot to follow through on a couple of requests. It was a busy Friday night.  We'll return to enjoy the great food and atmosphere.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We enjoyed  the food. It has a nice atmosphere.  Little bit dark I had to use extra light to see menu. Good Parking Space Across THE street.

data.title: Sushi and apps are the way to go!
data.text: I love the sushi and appetizers. Haven't tasted other meals.  We typically go there for the beer and atmosphere.

data.title: Exploding with flavor!
data.text: We had the crab rangoons and a poke along with our mahi mahi fish tacos. They were all exploding with flavor! Fair prices. Good service. We'll be back.

data.title: High Expectations...Big Letdown
data.text: My husband and I decided to try Label for his birthday last weekend and were excited when we looked at the menu online. The restaurant is beautiful and I loved the atmosphere. I'm a vegetarian, so I always have to check out my options beforehand. We both wanted burgers, and the build-your-own section was perfect for me. There were so many gourmet/foodie choices that were so appetizing! I ordered a black bean burger with grilled pineapple, red pepper jam, avocado, and lettuce with a side of sweet potato fries. My hubby had the signature burger with the garlic parmesean fries. Everything was homemade, upscale, and elevated...except for my FROZEN BLACK BEAN BURGER PATTY that was a base charge of $8!!!!! It was the exact same frozen patty that I have at home in my freezer...I was so disappointed and shocked...I just couldn't believe that they would cheapen all of their efforts (all delicious, by the way) by using a frozen burger. I really wanted to say something to the server about it, but I didn't. I just don't understand why they wouldn't choose to follow through and make it from scratch. Hopefully management will read this review and make this change because this made a huge negative first impression on me, despite all of the other positive aspects of the meal. We will go back, I will try the veggie pasta, and will probably ask if the black bean burgers are still frozen :)

data.title: Late Saturday Lunch
data.text: I had heard of Label's but had not ventured in that direction. It was around 1:30 and my husband and I decided to grab a bite before the football games began at 3:30 - headed to Johnson City and decided to give Label's a try.  The atmosphere is good - loved the decorations - but honestly, the food was not very good at all.  I would not go back for a meal - nothing about our food was worth bragging about.

data.title: Has the potential of being good to great but don't go there is there is a football game on TV
data.text: Had no idea how the Tennessee football game would negatively affect our food and service.   Our waitress actually went into a trance while we we giving her our order and she had her eye on the TV with the Tennessee football game on.  After ordering and waiting a while she came back to say they were out of the the specials and this was only 7:30 PM.  Reordered but she still got 2 of the four entrees mixed up and missing what was ordered

data.title: Family Birthday Outing
data.text: Our son picked this restaurant, not know you can't make same day reservations, but enjoyed being with the family while we waited.  Be aware, no reservations, long wait, but the management gave us a free appetizer with our meal, so that was nice.  Great atmosphere, some outside dining, wide assortment of beverages (alcohol) and a great menu.  Prices are fair, a little high.  Wait staff really nice.  Food was very good.

data.title: Fantastic taste of Johnson City!
data.text:
I enjoyed everything about this restaurant.

The location is in a fun, vibrant, historic part of town. 

The food menu is reasonably sized (not overwhelming), but well curated and full of variety. Our food was prepared to order, and very tasty.

The wine list is abbreviated but decent, and afternoon specials are very reasonable.

Our server was smiling and friendly and really "made" our experience.

We all loved the overall atmosphere and decor. I highly recommend a stop at Label when visiting Johnson City!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Very impressed with the bourbon/whiskey selection. The appetizers were nice too, I would recommend garlic paramsan fries. Dinner I had the dry aged ribeye and was delighted,  though the sea bass looked great and was recommended by the waitresses.

data.title: Save us a table at the Label...
data.text:
We stopped in for a late lunch.

Atmosphere was warm and inviting.  Hostess greeted us immediately...with a smile and conversation. 

Our waitress was friendly and competent
..took our drink order....drinks came quickly..nice beer selection...pints and 22oz drafts...nice and cold.

We ordered the firecracker shrimp for our appetizer...and it was just ok...the only low point of the meal...the shrimp were simply over cooked, tough and chewy...

I ordered a BLT with parmesan and garlic fries.

My companion ordered a spinach/strawberry and feta cheese salad with raspberry vinaigrette dressing.

The BLT was tasty with thick bacon, fried green tomatoes...guite good. The parmesan/garlic fries were fabulous.

The salad was fresh with melt in your mouth feta...scrupulous.

Our waitress was friendly/fun and attentive...our mugs stayed full.

Located just off I-26 in the heart of downtown Johnson City...we stopped in several cool shops on our way back to the car.

Great place to grab a bite and a beer....so save us a table....we will be back.

data.title: Nice place to dine
data.text: This is on of the higher quality restaurants in the Tri-Cities and is similar to what you find in more "foodie" destinations like Asheville.  The atmosphere, service, and food were all great.

data.title: What a great experience!
data.text:
Great selection of libations with wonderful food. We tried appetizers: lamb was the best but also good were spring rolls and fried pickles. My salad tower with salmon was so delicious. 

Service was outstanding, as well.

data.title: Birthday dinner for 5
data.text:
We came to the Label on Monday, Sept. 19, for my daughters
birthday.  We were seated promptly, but waited for drinks or a waitress for about 15 or 20 minutes.  We finally ordered and it took approx. 30 to 45 minutes to receive our food.  We had hamburgers and chicken sandwiches.  The burgers were dry and the fries were cold and soggy.  My daughter said a Wendys chicken sandwich would taste better.  The food was definately not worth the long wait.

data.title: An excellent find in downtown Johnson city TN
data.text: As a visitor, the downtown area of Johnson city TN appears to be in the process of a slow but impressive facelift and renovation, with food, cultural and other attractions all within a short walk of each other.  LR is part of that--a very nice restaurant placed in a much older building, with very good food at very reasonable prices all supported by a properly large menu of beer, wine, and other adult beverages.  Service has been (3 visits so far in the past year) friendly and professional; atmosphere pleasant; food well seasoned, tastefully presented, and reasonably priced.  It can get busy, so plan ahead.  Well worth a visit when in the area!

data.title: Love the label
data.text: My husband and I have eaten here many times and have never been disappointed.  Very good every time. Great menu items and even a kids menu.

data.title: Best Burgers in Town!
data.text: Great burgers and several excellent sides to choose from!  Sweet potato parmesan fries are the best!  Good atmosphere, not too fancy so all members of family can enjoy!

data.title: Great food
data.text: Best is filet mignon or bison burger. All of the desserts that we have tried have been great as well. It seems to be most popular on weekend nights, so if you want a table you want to come in early or on a less busy day.
